intro: Crotalaria pseudopodocarpa, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils, and it is often found in disturbed areas. Its seeds are adapted for dispersal by wind, and the plant plays a role in soil stabilization and nitrogen fixation. Crotalaria pseudopodocarpa is also known for its ability to suppress weed growth through allelopathy.
